text: surgery tourists : almost a third of brits having cosmetic surgery are opting to go under the knife abroad . a third of brits who opt for cosmetic surgery such as boob jobs and face lifts now travel abroad to get it done on the cheap , according to a new study . the research suggests we have become a nation of cosmetic surgery tourists , with many seeking lower-cost elective procedures in eastern europe . but , worryingly , more than half are unhappy with the results and one in five had to have further treatment back in britain to correct problems . the czech republic is the country of choice for breast enlargements with 19 per cent of women choosing to go there . meanwhile , almost one in five lip fillers and nose jobs are also carried out in the country . others travel even further afield with the research by confused.com finding thailand is extremely popular among brits seeking teeth-whitening procedures . more than a quarter of those getting their teeth done abroad -lrb- 28 per cent -rrb- head for the south-east asian country . switzerland was found to be the top destination for face-lifts -lrb- 29 per cent -rrb- , botox -lrb- 28 per cent -rrb- and liposuction -lrb- 14 per cent -rrb- . the price comparison website discovered 30 per cent who have had cosmetic procedures travelled abroad . the main factor is the cheaper cost of surgery in other countries . treatment abroad : switzerland is the country of choice for those wishing to undergo liposuction . a quarter -lrb- 25 per cent -rrb- said they went overseas because they could n't afford to have the procedure done in the uk . others claim they opted for surgery abroad so they could combine it with a holiday at the same time -lrb- 20 per cent -rrb- . but it seems it may be a false economy with a greater risk of botched operations . less than half were pleased with the results -lrb- 46 per cent -rrb- , and only 15 per cent would recommend others do the same . one in five who opted for a foreign cosmetic procedure -lrb- 19 per cent -rrb- had to have further treatments to correct a problem , compared to just 6 per cent who stayed in the uk . it seems other complications are more likely to affect those who go under the knife abroad , according to the survey of 1,559 cosmetic surgery patients . under the knife : the czech republic is the country of choice for breast enlargements with 19 per cent of women choosing to go there . a third claim to have caught an infection -lrb- 33 per cent -rrb- , whereas only 9 per cent say this happened after a procedure in the uk . many flock to overseas clinics they know have been visited by celebrities . the study found one in ten -lrb- 10 per cent -rrb- chose a clinic or surgeon because it had been used by a star . not satisfied : less than half of people having surgery abroad are unhappy with the results . a similar number -lrb- 11 per cent -rrb- opted to use somewhere recommended by friends or family . despite the apparently heightened risks of heading abroad for procedures , only 14 per cent notified their doctor before travelling . confused.com advise those travelling abroad for medical treatment should ensure they are adequately protected should the worst happen . yet only a third -lrb- 33 per cent -rrb- took out travel insurance , with even fewer notifying their existing insurer -lrb- 29 per cent -rrb- of their plans . mhairi edwards , head of travel insurance at confused.com said : ` our research suggests cosmetic surgery tourism is now a popular trend among brits . ` if consumers are tempted by a nip and tuck or a brighter smile at a smaller cost , we urge them to do their homework so their bargain treatment does not prove to be a costly mistake . ` potential patients go overseas where prices are lower and procedures are more readily accessible . ` however , it is clear there are increased risks associated with travelling abroad for cosmetic procedures . ` those considering surgery or procedures abroad should ensure they are fully protected , because they could be left in the lurch if things go wrong . ` notifying your doctor and ensuring you have adequate travel insurance is a must . ` travellers should also be aware normal travel insurance might not cover them for all procedures abroad , so they need to be thorough when choosing the right policy for them . '
